p: From a list of climatic hazards, windstorms and tornadoes were identified by the largest proportion of respondents as having caused significant damage to their sugar bush in the last decades (53%), followed by ice storms (40%), insect outbreaks (17%), droughts (14%), and invasive plant species (12%) ( Fig 5). Significant models were obtained only for ice storms (Fig Q in S3 File) and insect outbreaks (Fig R in S3 File). Interestingly, respondents from southern Canada with more than 10 years of experience were more likely to report damages by ice storms to their sugar bushes during the last decades (Fig Q in S3 File). This pattern can be explained by the large areas of forest damaged by the ice storm of January 1998 that befell on the province of Quebec [ 89â€“ 91].
